title: POS Options
text: The PoS Admin - POS Options menu should be used in preference to this menu, Admin will be removed in future releases and will not be accessible In this section, you can control various behaviours within the POS (Point of Sale) system. Please select the specific location for which you want to make changes. Once you have made the desired changes, click on "Save". Hide last sale details when the clerk is logged out - When a clerk logs out, the Last Sale Total and Change will display as 0.00 instead of showing the actual amounts. Hide chart on POS - The sales chart on the POS log-on screen will not be shown. Ask if the customer will receive a receipt as mail - When enabled, the clerk will have the option to email a receipt in addition to the POS automatically printing it. If a customer is selected and has a valid email address, the receipt will be sent to that email address when the clerk presses the 'Email Receipt' button. If this option is unchecked, a receipt will be printed automatically, but the clerk will not have the option to email it, regardless of whether a customer is selected or not. Please note that this option is overridden by the "The receipt should be emailed instead of printed as default" option, which always offers an email receipt option. The receipt should be emailed instead of printed as default - When enabled, the POS will not automatically print a receipt. The clerk will have the ability to manually print a receipt or send an email receipt, but not both. This option takes precedence over the "Ask if the customer will receive a receipt as mail" option by always offering an email receipt option. Stay logged in after finished sale - After completing a sale, the clerk will remain logged in without being prompted for their login details again. The clerk must manually log out if stepping away from the POS. Automatically aggregate identical item lines in a transaction - When this option is checked, items with the same barcode will be listed as a single line on the POS. The receipt will also display a single line with the total quantity. Allow overcharging of payment cards - Enabling this option allows for surcharges to be added to the receipt for payment cards. Only managers can do returns - By checking this option, only managers will be able to authorize returns or perform transactions that require management credentials. Refer to @ Clerk for more information. POS Discount Buttons - Use these options to customize the discount buttons on the POS according to your requirements. For more details, see Line Discount. Remember to click Save to apply and save any changes you have made.

The PoS Admin - POS Options menu should be used in preference to this menu, Admin will be removed in future releases and will not be accessible


In this section, you can control various behaviours within the POS (Point of Sale) system. Please select the specific location for which you want to make changes. Once you have made the desired changes, click on "Save".



Hide last sale details when the clerk is logged out - When a clerk logs out, the Last Sale Total and Change will display as 0.00 instead of showing the actual amounts.


Hide chart on POS - The sales chart on the POS log-on screen will not be shown.


Ask if the customer will receive a receipt as mail - When enabled, the clerk will have the option to email a receipt in addition to the POS automatically printing it. If a customer is selected and has a valid email address, the receipt will be sent to that email address when the clerk presses the 'Email Receipt' button. If this option is unchecked, a receipt will be printed automatically, but the clerk will not have the option to email it, regardless of whether a customer is selected or not. Please note that this option is overridden by the "The receipt should be emailed instead of printed as default" option, which always offers an email receipt option.


The receipt should be emailed instead of printed as default - When enabled, the POS will not automatically print a receipt. The clerk will have the ability to manually print a receipt or send an email receipt, but not both. This option takes precedence over the "Ask if the customer will receive a receipt as mail" option by always offering an email receipt option.


Stay logged in after finished sale - After completing a sale, the clerk will remain logged in without being prompted for their login details again. The clerk must manually log out if stepping away from the POS.


Automatically aggregate identical item lines in a transaction - When this option is checked, items with the same barcode will be listed as a single line on the POS. The receipt will also display a single line with the total quantity.


Allow overcharging of payment cards - Enabling this option allows for surcharges to be added to the receipt for payment cards.


Only managers can do returns - By checking this option, only managers will be able to authorize returns or perform transactions that require management credentials. Refer to @ Clerk for more information.


POS Discount Buttons - Use these options to customize the discount buttons on the POS according to your requirements. For more details, see Line Discount.


Remember to click Save to apply and save any changes you have made.

title: Expansions
text: The PoS Admin - Expansion menu should be used in preference to this menu, Admin will be removed in future releases and will not be accessible Introduction: The Expansion framework, accessed through the Admin > Expansions Module, allows for the configuration of third-party extensions. Typically, your K3 representative will handle the setup of these extensions if needed. The Expansion Framework enables the integration of external extensions hosted outside of the Imagine platform, providing additional functionality beyond what is currently offered by Imagine. It is primarily available for Self Serve and Simple POS applications. Typical Uses: One example of using the Expansion framework is during a transaction before payment is made. At this point, a unique identifier is sent to the third-party API, identifying the session and the basket. Imagine will open a window for the external services to interact with the user and await a completion message. The third-party application can perform custom actions, such as collecting additional information from the user or directly interacting with the Imagine basket object. Expansions offer the ability to incorporate additional functions that may not be relevant or accessible to the retailer directly. For instance, there might be a shop feature that requires K3 to set up and configure, but the retailer needs the capability to enable or disable the feature independently. Clean Cash: If Clean Cash is enabled for the tenant and shop, you can enable or disable it within the Expansion framework. Please refer to the Clean Cash notes for information on when it can be temporarily disabled.

The PoS Admin - Expansion menu should be used in preference to this menu, Admin will be removed in future releases and will not be accessible 


Introduction:

The Expansion framework, accessed through the Admin > Expansions Module, allows for the configuration of third-party extensions. Typically, your K3 representative will handle the setup of these extensions if needed. The Expansion Framework enables the integration of external extensions hosted outside of the Imagine platform, providing additional functionality beyond what is currently offered by Imagine. It is primarily available for Self Serve and Simple POS applications.


Typical Uses:

One example of using the Expansion framework is during a transaction before payment is made. At this point, a unique identifier is sent to the third-party API, identifying the session and the basket. Imagine will open a window for the external services to interact with the user and await a completion message. The third-party application can perform custom actions, such as collecting additional information from the user or directly interacting with the Imagine basket object.


Expansions offer the ability to incorporate additional functions that may not be relevant or accessible to the retailer directly. For instance, there might be a shop feature that requires K3 to set up and configure, but the retailer needs the capability to enable or disable the feature independently.


Clean Cash:

If Clean Cash is enabled for the tenant and shop, you can enable or disable it within the Expansion framework. Please refer to the Clean Cash notes for information on when it can be temporarily disabled.
